cluster_relations.rel_desc: Body language is said to convey a wide range of emotions.

qualifiers.OtherQualifier: ContentScope: wide range of emotional states

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Body language is said to convey intentions.
The use of body language to convey emotions specifically targets emotional states as what is expressed.
cluster_relations.subject_entity_name: use of body language to convey emotions
cluster_relations.subject_class_label: Body Language Usage in Daily Life

qualifiers.UncertaintyQualifier: one of the most common ways

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Gestures are used to convey messages without words.
Body language is described as a channel through which emotions are conveyed.
Body language is described as a channel through which intentions are conveyed.
These signals are transmitted using body language as the channel.
Body language serves as a primary medium through which communication is conveyed.
remarks: Overlaps conceptually with being a form of communication but emphasizes channel role.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Body language is used to convey emotions.
Body language is used to convey intentions.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that a communicative behavior or channel carries or expresses a particular type of informational content (e.g., emotions, intentions, messages).
args.justification: All these relations link a nonverbal communicative behavior or its use (body language, gestures, use of body language) to the informational content it expresses (emotions, intentions, messages). They share the same core predicate semantics: the behavior/channel conveys that content.
Each relation connects a communicative act or channel with the semantic content it carries; this is best modeled as a communication-content family of relations.
All these relations concern what is communicated by nonverbal behaviors, fitting a broad communication-oriented group.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that a signal or message is expressed or transmitted through a particular medium or channel.
args.justification: This relation links signals sent through body language (content) to body language (channel), emphasizing that the signals are expressed via that medium.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that an entity functions as a medium or channel for a communication process.
args.justification: This relation links body language (channel) to communication (process), emphasizing body language's role as the medium through which communication is conveyed.
Both relations describe how communication content or processes are linked to their channel/medium (body language), which naturally groups into a communication-medium relation class.
These relations concern the channel or medium through which communication occurs, fitting under a broad communication-related semantic group.

They share the same core predicate semantics: the behavior/channel conveys that content.
Each relation connects a communicative act or channel with the semantic content it carries; this is best modeled as a communication-content family of relations.
All these relations concern what is communicated by nonverbal behaviors, fitting a broad communication-oriented group.

executed_decisions.justification: This relation links body language (channel) to communication (process), emphasizing body language's role as the medium through which communication is conveyed.
Both relations describe how communication content or processes are linked to their channel/medium (body language), which naturally groups into a communication-medium relation class.
These relations concern the channel or medium through which communication occurs, fitting under a broad communication-related semantic group.
